page.title: 03Road Haulage Firm
page.content: {B.J.Waters }have thirty five lorries altogether.These lorries carry any tippable things from coal to apples all around the country.The boss of the firm is now {Tim Waters.}It used to be his dad, {Bernard John,}who started the firm back in 1956.Some lorry drivers travel 300-800 miles in an eight hour day.The lorries,which are mostly{Seddon Atkinson,}can get up to a top speed of sixty m/p/h.On their day trip the lorry drivers can get quite peckish so they take their own food or stop at cafes.In the twenty nine years the firm has been going they have had some accidents,but none of them serious.The firm only uses lorries because you can't tip with things like vans!Because of insurance it is a firm rule that the drivers must not pick up hitch-hikers or take companions with them on their trips.
